when_to_say: Used to express gratitude in informal settings.
example: ありがとう、手伝ってくれて！ (arigatou, tetsudatte kurete!) - Thank you for helping me!

when_to_say: Used as a general greeting in the afternoon.
example: こんにちは、お元気ですか？ (konnichiwa, o-genki desu ka?) - Hello, how are you?

when_to_say: Used when parting ways for a longer period.
example: さようなら、また明日！ (sayounara, mata ashita!) - Goodbye, see you tomorrow!

when_to_say: Used to apologize or get someone's attention.
example: すみません、道を教えてください。(sumimasen, michi o oshiete kudasai.) - Excuse me, could you tell me the way?

when_to_say: Used when making polite requests.
example: コーヒーをお願いします。(koohii o onegaishimasu.) - Coffee, please.

when_to_say: Used as a morning greeting.
example: おはよう、今日はいい天気ですね。(ohayou, kyou wa ii tenki desu ne.) - Good morning, it’s a nice day today!

when_to_say: Used to affirm or agree with something.
example: はい、わかりました。(hai, wakarimashita.) - Yes, I understand.

when_to_say: Used to negate or disagree.
example: いいえ、ちがいます。(iie, chigaimasu.) - No, that’s incorrect.

when_to_say: Used when talking about a companion or peer.
example: 私の友達はとても親切です。(watashi no tomodachi wa totemo shinsetsu desu.) - My friend is very kind.

when_to_say: Used to describe something aesthetically pleasing.
example: この花は美しいです。(kono hana wa utsukushii desu.) - This flower is beautiful.

when_to_say: Used when referring to eating something.
example: 昼ご飯を食べる。(hirugohan o taberu.) - I will eat lunch.

when_to_say: Used when referring to seeing something.
example: 映画を見るのが好きです。(eiga o miru no ga suki desu.) - I like watching movies.

when_to_say: Used when referring to walking.
example: 公園を歩く。(kouen o aruku.) - I walk in the park.

when_to_say: Used to describe someone's health or energy levels.
example: 私は元気です。(watashi wa genki desu.) - I am energetic.

when_to_say: Used to describe something that is large in size.
example: その車は大きいです。(sono kuruma wa ookii desu.) - That car is big.

when_to_say: Used to describe something that is small in size.
example: 小さい犬がいます。(chiisai inu ga imasu.) - There is a small dog.

when_to_say: Used to describe speed or time.
example: 電車は早いです。(densha wa hayai desu.) - The train is fast.

when_to_say: Used to describe something that is slow or late.
example: バスは遅いです。(basu wa osoi desu.) - The bus is slow.

when_to_say: Used when talking about meals.
example: 食事の準備をします。(shokuji no junbi o shimasu.) - I will prepare the meal.

when_to_say: Used when referring to the weather.
example: 今日は天気がいいですね。(kyou wa tenki ga ii desu ne.) - The weather is nice today.

when_to_say: Used when referring to the act of understanding something complex.
example: この問題を理解するのは難しいです。(kono mondai o rikai suru no wa muzukashii desu.) - It is difficult to understand this problem.

when_to_say: Used when referring to searching or looking for something.
example: 新しい仕事を探しています。(atarashii shigoto o sagashiteimasu.) - I am looking for a new job.

when_to_say: Used when referring to making an effort or working hard.
example: 成功するためには努力が必要です。(seikou suru tame ni wa doryoku ga hitsuyou desu.) - Effort is necessary to succeed.

when_to_say: Used to describe something of great importance.
example: これは非常に重要な問題です。(kore wa hijou ni juuyou na mondai desu.) - This is a very important issue.

when_to_say: Used when talking about regular habits or customs.
example: 毎朝ジョギングをするのが習慣です。(mai asa jogingu o suru no ga shuukan desu.) - Jogging every morning is a habit.

when_to_say: Used when referring to the act of proving something.
example: 証明書を提出してください。(shoumeisho o teishutsu shite kudasai.) - Please submit the proof.

when_to_say: Used to describe something that is possible.
example: それは可能ですか？(sore wa kanou desu ka?) - Is that possible?

when_to_say: Used when referring to the process of analyzing something.
example: 市場のデータを分析しています。(shijou no deeta o bunseki shiteimasu.) - I am analyzing the market data.

when_to_say: Used to describe something that is complicated or complex.
example: その問題は非常に複雑です。(sono mondai wa hijou ni fukuzatsu desu.) - That problem is very complex.

when_to_say: Used when referring to new ideas or innovation.
example: テクノロジーの革新が進んでいます。(tekunorojii no kakushin ga susundeimasu.) - Innovation in technology is advancing.

when_to_say: Used when referring to drinking something.
example: ジュースを飲みます。(juusu o nomimasu.) - I drink juice.

when_to_say: Used when referring to writing something.
example: 手紙を書きます。(tegami o kakimasu.) - I write a letter.

when_to_say: Used to express happiness or joy.
example: 試験に合格して嬉しいです。(shiken ni goukaku shite ureshii desu.) - I am happy to pass the exam.

when_to_say: Used to describe a difficult situation or obstacle.
example: 彼は困難を乗り越えました。(kare wa konnan o norikoemashita.) - He overcame the difficulty.

when_to_say: Used when referring to being late.
example: 彼は遅刻しました。(kare wa chikoku shimashita.) - He was late.

when_to_say: Used to describe being in a desperate or intense situation.
example: 必死に働いています。(hisshi ni hataraiteimasu.) - I am working desperately.

when_to_say: Used to refer to someone who brings about innovation.
example: 彼は革新者として有名です。(kare wa kakushin-sha toshite yuumei desu.) - He is famous as an innovator.

when_to_say: Used when referring to the effect of two or more things interacting.
example: 化学反応は相互作用によって起こります。(kagaku hannou wa sougo sayou ni yotte okorimasu.) - Chemical reactions occur due to interactions.

when_to_say: Used when referring to taking on a challenge or attempting something difficult.
example: 彼は新しい挑戦を始めました。(kare wa atarashii chousen o hajimemashita.) - He started a new challenge.

when_to_say: Used when describing feelings of anxiety or unease.
example: 試験前に不安を感じています。(shiken mae ni fuan o kanjiteimasu.) - I feel anxious before the exam.

when_to_say: Used when referring to the act of studying or learning.
example: 毎日勉強します。(mainichi benkyou shimasu.) - I study every day.

when_to_say: Used when referring to food.
example: 日本の食べ物が好きです。(nihon no tabemono ga suki desu.) - I like Japanese food.

when_to_say: Used to describe something enjoyable or fun.
example: 今日は楽しい一日でした。(kyou wa tanoshii ichinichi deshita.) - Today was a fun day.

when_to_say: Used when teaching or instructing someone.
example: 私は日本語を教えています。(watashi wa nihongo o oshieteimasu.) - I am teaching Japanese.

when_to_say: Used to describe something inconvenient or troublesome.
example: この場所は不便です。(kono basho wa fuben desu.) - This place is inconvenient.

when_to_say: Used when referring to a promise or agreement.
example: 私は彼と約束しました。(watashi wa kare to yakusoku shimashita.) - I made a promise with him.

when_to_say: Used when expressing surprise.
example: 彼の知らせに驚きました。(kare no shirase ni odorokimashita.) - I was surprised by his news.

when_to_say: Used when talking about someone's or something's charm or attraction.
example: その街には魅力があります。(sono machi ni wa miryoku ga arimasu.) - That town has charm.

when_to_say: Used when referring to showing respect.
example: 私は彼を尊敬しています。(watashi wa kare o sonkei shiteimasu.) - I respect him.

when_to_say: Used when referring to solving a problem or resolving an issue.
example: 問題を解決する方法を探しています。(mondai o kaiketsu suru houhou o sagashiteimasu.) - I am looking for a way to solve the problem.

when_to_say: Used to describe a state of being happy or content.
example: 私は幸せです。(watashi wa shiawase desu.) - I am happy.

when_to_say: Used when offering help or assistance.
example: 何か手伝いましょうか？(nanika tetsudaimashou ka?) - Can I help you with something?

when_to_say: Used to refer to a close or dear friend.
example: 彼は私の友人です。(kare wa watashi no yuujin desu.) - He is my friend.

when_to_say: Used to express dislike or hatred.
example: 私は辛い食べ物が嫌いです。(watashi wa karai tabemono ga kirai desu.) - I hate spicy food.

when_to_say: Used when referring to working together with others.
example: みんなで協力しましょう。(minna de kyouryoku shimashou.) - Let's cooperate together.

when_to_say: Used to express expectations or hopes.
example: 彼に大きな期待をしています。(kare ni ookina kitai o shiteimasu.) - I have high expectations of him.

when_to_say: Used to refer to artistic creation or expression.
example: 彼は芸術に興味があります。(kare wa geijutsu ni kyomi ga arimasu.) - He is interested in art.

when_to_say: Used when referring to a drastic change or revolution.
example: その国は革命を経験しました。(sono kuni wa kakumei o keiken shimashita.) - The country experienced a revolution.

when_to_say: Used when referring to data or statistical analysis.
example: 統計によると、人口は増加しています。(toukei ni yoru to, jinkou wa zouka shiteimasu.) - According to statistics, the population is increasing.

when_to_say: Used to refer to the process of evolution or development.
example: 生物の進化は時間をかけて進みます。(seibutsu no shinka wa jikan o kakete susumimasu.) - The evolution of living organisms progresses over time.
